item.title: Calming the Tempest
item.description: The disciples' faith is tested before Jesus calms the stormy sea.

item.title: Parable of the Sower
item.description: Jesus explains why he teaches with parables and gives the parable of the sower to a multitude gathered on the seashore.

item.title: Laborers in the Vineyard
item.description: Jesus gives the parable of the laborers in the Vineyard.

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Wheat & Tares, Mustard Seed, and Leaven
item.description: Jesus uses parables to teach a crowd of people about the kingdom of heaven.

item.title: Lazarus is Raised from the Dead
item.description: Jesus testifies that He is the resurrection and the life. He raises Lazarus from the dead that His disciples may believe.

item.title: Feed My Sheep
item.description: Jesus shows Himself to His disciples and implores Peter to feed His sheep.

item.title: Wherefore Didst Thou Doubt?
item.description: Jesus walks on water, and bids Peter to come unto Him.

item.title: The Feeding of the 5000
item.description: Jesus provides a meal for 5000 people with only 5 loaves of bread and two fishes.

item.title: Christ's Authority is Questioned
item.description: Christ's authority is questioned by the chief priests and elders. He relates the parable of the two sons to them.

item.title: Widow Of Nain
item.description: Jesus raises the son of the widow of Nain from death.

item.title: I Have Kept the Faith
item.description: Paul endures to the end and gives a solemn charge to preach the gospel in a day of apostasy.

item.title: Charity Never Faileth
item.description: Charity, the pure love of Christ, exceeds almost all else.

item.title: Be of Good Cheer
item.description: Paul is comforted and told by the Lord that he must bear witness of Him in Rome.

item.title: Unity of the Faith
item.description: Paul writes of one Lord, one faith, one baptism and one Father. Christ appointed apostles, prophets, and teachers to help unify and perfect the saints.

item.title: Ye Are No More Strangers
item.description: Paul teaches that the atonement of Jesus Christ is available for all of God's children.

item.title: We Are the Offspring of God
item.description: Paul preaches to Athenians on Mars Hill and identifies their "unknown god" as the Father of us all. He testifies that we all are children of God.

item.title: The Jerusalem Conference
item.description: Peter and James speak to the Saints in Jerusalem to convince them that the Gentile converts are not subject to the requirements of the Law of Moses.

item.title: The Road to Damascus
item.description: Saul takes his journey to Damascus. While on the road, Jesus appears to Saul. He is blinded by the event. Ananias restores Saul’s sight. Saul is baptized.

item.title: Blessed Are They That Have Not Seen, and Yet Have Believed
item.description: Thomas, one of the twelve, doubts the appearance of the risen Lord. Christ appears, and tells him, “Blessed are those who have not seen, and yet have believed.”

item.title: The Risen Lord Appears to the Apostles
item.description: The resurrected Christ appears to the apostles and tells them “Peace be unto you!” They touch His hands and feet and He eats with them. He tells them He will send them as His father sent Him.

item.title: Christ Appears on the Road to Emmaus
item.description: The resurrected Christ walks with two men on the road to Emmaus. He blesses and breaks bread with them, and then vanishes from sight. Their hearts burned within them.

item.title: My Kingdom Is Not of This World
item.description: Jesus is persecuted, mocked and crucified. His followers mourn, and find the tomb empty on the third day. The Son of God breaks the bands of death and ascends to His Father in Heaven. -Easter Part 2

item.title: To This End Was I Born
item.description: Jesus Christ, the only begotten Son of God, and King of the Jews, was born to offer Himself as a sacrifice to atone for the sins of mankind. -Easter Part 1

item.title: A House Divided
item.description: The Son of God declares that blasphemy against the Holy Ghost shall not be forgiven, and that a house divided against itself shall fall.

item.title: Christ and the Rich Young Ruler
item.description: Jesus Christ, the Son of God, teaches a rich man how to gain eternal life.

item.title: The Naming of John the Baptist
item.description: John the Baptist is born. Zacharias prophesies of John’s mission to prepare the way for the Son of God.

item.title: Young Jesus Teaches in the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph find Jesus about His father's business, teaching in the temple.

item.title: The Ten Virgins
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the ten virgins.

item.title: The Parable of the Talents
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the talents.

item.title: Ye Have Done it Unto Me
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the sheep and the goats.

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: Mary conceives by the power of the Holy Ghost – Heavenly messengers herald the birth of Jesus in Bethlehem.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Man Born Blind
item.description: On the sabbath day, Jesus heals a man born blind.

item.title: Jesus Teaches that We Must Become as Little Children
item.description: Those who humble themselves as little children are the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

item.title: Suffer the Little Children to Come unto Me
item.description: Jesus invites little children to come unto him, and teaches how to gain eternal life.

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Lost Sheep
item.description: Jesus teaches there shall be joy in heaven over one repentant sinner.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Lame Man on the Sabbath
item.description: Jesus performs a miracle by healing an invalid on the sabbath day.

item.title: Seek Ye the Kingdom of God
item.description: Jesus teaches not to lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, but rather to lay up treasures in heaven.

item.title: Follow Me, and I Will Make You Fishers of Men
item.description: Jesus calls Peter, Andrew, James and John to follow Him.

item.title: The Good Shepherd and Other Sheep I Have
item.description: Jesus is the Good Shepherd. He declares that His Father commanded Him to lay down His life, and take it up again.

item.title: Jesus Acclaims John the Baptist / Come Unto Me
item.description: Jesus acclaims John the Baptist; rebukes unbelievers; and declares His burden is light.

item.title: Peter's Revelation to Take the Gospel to the Gentiles
item.description: Peter follows the commandment of the Lord to take the gospel to the Gentiles.

item.title: Forgive 70 Times 7
item.description: Jesus explains how we are to treat our offending brethren.

item.title: The Prodigal Son
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the prodigal son.

item.title: The Kingdom of Heaven
item.description: The kingdom of heaven consists of the just separated out from the wicked.

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Wheat and the Tares
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the wheat and the tares to the disciples.

item.title: The Greatest Commandment
item.description: Jesus declares the first and great commandment is to love God with all your heart.

item.title: I am the Bread of Life
item.description: Jesus teaches He is the bread of life, and how salvation is gained by eating the living bread. Peter testifies that Jesus is the anointed Son of God.

item.title: Whosoever Will Lose His Life for My Sake Shall Find It
item.description: Jesus foretells of His death and resurrection. After He comes in the glory of His Father, every man shall be rewarded according to their works.

item.title: Thou Art the Christ
item.description: Peter testifies that Jesus is the Son of God. Jesus declares that He will give the keys of the kingdom to Peter.

item.title: Render unto Caesar and unto God
item.description: Conspiring men seek to entangle Jesus in His words. Instead, the Savior wittingly teaches them that it is possible to respect civil authority and honor God.

item.title: Peter and John Continue Preaching the Gospel
item.description: Peter and John continue preaching and healing in the name of Jesus Christ, despite the attempts of the Jewish leaders to stop them.

item.title: Peter and John Are Judged
item.description: Peter and John preach in the name of Jesus Christ, and are brought before the leaders of the Jews for questioning.

item.title: Peter Preaches and is Arrested
item.description: Peter and John are arrested for preaching the gospel of Jesus Christ in Jerusalem.

item.title: Peter and John Heal a Man Crippled Since Birth
item.description: With authority from Jesus Christ, Peter and John heal a man crippled since birth.

item.title: Good Tidings of Great Joy: The Birth of Jesus Christ
item.description: Share the good tidings of great joy: that He lives!

item.title: For God So Loved the World
item.description: Give thanks for the Lord Jesus Christ: His life, His atoning sacrifice, and His resurrection.

item.title: Jesus Declares: I Am the Light of the World, the Truth Shall Make You Free
item.description: Jesus declares that He is the light of the world, and the Son of God. Whosoever will embrace His gospel and follow Him can be freed from sin.

item.title: Jesus Cleanses the Temple
item.description: Jesus clears worldly merchandise from the temple courts in order to keep the temple a holy place.

item.title: Jesus Forgives Sins and Heals a Man Stricken with Palsy
item.description: Jesus shows that He has power to both forgive sins and heal physical infirmities.

item.title: Jesus Raises the Daughter of Jairus
item.description: Jesus demonstrates His divine power by raising a young girl from the dead.

item.title: Go and Sin No More
item.description: Jesus teaches about compassion when confronted with a woman accused of adultery.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: Treasures in Heaven
item.description: In His Sermon on the Mount, Jesus teaches His disciples what it means to be a compassionate follower of His Gospel.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: The Lord's Prayer
item.description: Jesus teaches his disciples the correct manner of prayer and offers the Lord's prayer.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: The Higher Law
item.description: Jesus teaches His followers essential Christian traits, such as kindness, forgiveness, and love.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: The Beatitudes
item.description: Jesus describes the characteristics of true Christians.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Woman of Faith
item.description: Jesus heals a woman's illness when she, in faith, touches His clothing.

item.title: Jesus Calls Twelve Apostles to Preach and Bless Others
item.description: Jesus instructs and empowers His original Twelve Apostles.

item.title: Jesus Declares He Is the Messiah
item.description: Jesus announces that He is the Messiah prophesied by Isaiah, but is rejected by His neighbors in Nazareth.

item.title: Jesus Teaches of Being Born Again
item.description: In the darkness of night, Jesus teaches Nicodemus about the necessity of every person being born again.

item.title: Mary, the Mother of Jesus
item.description: Mary was highly favored of God and chosen to be the mother of Jesus Christ. Her humility, devotion, and strength stand as a model for all Christian disciples.

item.title: The Baptism of Jesus
item.description: Jesus seeks out John the Baptist and is baptized in order to fulfill all righteousness.

item.title: Jesus Turns Water into Wine
item.description: Jesus performs a miraculous act of service in one of the first recorded events of His ministry.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Possessed Man
item.description: Jesus demonstrates His divine power by healing a possessed man.

item.title: He is Risen
item.description: Ponder what the Savior means to all humanity—and to you personally. And then share the good news.

item.title: Jesus Is Resurrected
item.description: Peter and John find the empty tomb. Jesus, now resurrected, appears to Mary.

item.title: Jesus Is Laid in a Tomb
item.description: The Savior's body is taken by Joseph of Arimathea to a garden tomb. Angels appear and remove the stone from the front of the tomb. Mary and other women visit the empty tomb.

item.title: Jesus Is Scourged and Crucified
item.description: A band of soldiers strips Jesus of His clothes, scourges Him, and mocks Him. He then carries His cross to Golgotha and is crucified by Roman soldiers.

item.title: Jesus Is Condemned Before Pilate
item.description: Jesus is arraigned and questioned before Pilate, who finds no fault in Him. Yielding to the multitude, Pilate allows Barabbas to be released and Jesus to be crucified.

item.title: Jesus Is Tried by Caiaphas, Peter Denies Knowing Him
item.description: Jesus is tried before Caiaphas and the chief priests. Peter denies knowing Him and weeps bitterly.

item.title: The Savior Suffers in Gethsemane
item.description: Jesus, Peter, James, and John retire to the Garden of Gethsemane. Jesus submits to the Father's will and begins to suffer for the sins and afflictions of mankind. He is then betrayed and arrested.

item.title: Jesus Warns Peter and Offers the Intercessory Prayer
item.description: Jesus admonishes Peter to remain faithful and strengthen his brethren. Peter professes his devotion to Jesus. Jesus foretells Peter's denial and then gives the Intercessory Prayer.

item.title: The Last Supper
item.description: Meeting in an upper room with His disciples, Jesus washes their feet, institutes the sacrament, and commands them to love one another.

item.title: The Lord's Triumphal Entry into Jerusalem
item.description: Jesus rides in triumph into Jerusalem. The multitudes greet Him with shouts of Hosanna to the Son of David.

item.title: Jesus Teaches a Samaritan Woman
item.description: While traveling through Samaria, the Savior teaches a woman at Jacob's Well that He is the "living water."

item.title: Parable of the Good Samaritan
item.description: A depiction of the Savior's parable of the good Samaritan, in which a man is robbed and beaten by thieves, and a Samaritan shows mercy on him.

item.title: Jesus Teaches about the Widow's Mites
item.description: A poor widow contributes her all into the temple treasury. Jesus teaches that her contribution is greater than that of the rich who gave of their abundance.

item.title: The Wise Men Seek Jesus
item.description: The Wise Men present Jesus with gifts—gold, frankincense, and myrrh. After their visit, Mary and Joseph flee to Egypt to protect Jesus from the wicked King Herod, who wishes to kill the child.

item.title: The Christ Child Is Presented at the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph take Jesus to the temple, where the righteous Simeon blesses the baby and rejoices that the Lord let him live to see this day.

item.title: Shepherds Learn of the Birth of Christ
item.description: The angel Gabriel announces the birth of Jesus to the shepherds. The shepherds then visit Mary, Joseph, and the newborn Jesus.

item.title: Mary and Joseph Travel to Bethlehem
item.description: Traveling to their ancestral city of Bethlehem, Mary and Joseph are unable to find a room in an inn. Instead, they find shelter in a place where animals are kept.

item.title: Mary and Elisabeth Rejoice Together
item.description: Mary visits her relative Elisabeth, who in her old age will also soon give birth to a miraculous child. The women rejoice together.

item.title: An Angel Foretells Christ’s Birth to Mary
item.description: The angel Gabriel, sent from the presence of God, announces to the young Mary her future role as the mother of the child Jesus.
